projectOpen.label: N5_Kanji_Grid
projectOpen.title: N5 Kanji Grid:
projectOpen.projectDescription: A grid of JLPT N5 kanji based on the pre-2010 exams using WebVR with Three.js. The interesting thing here is the use of two renderers for CSS3D and WebGL. Note that only a single camera is used with OrbitalControls; there's no child camera for VrControls.

projectOpen.label: Dilution Calculator
projectOpen.title: Dilution Calculator
projectOpen.projectDescription: An exceedingly simple Android Java app to calculate dilutions based on the standard formula C1V1 = C2V2, where C1 is the initial concentration, C2 the final concentration, V1 the initial volume, and V2 the final volume.

projectOpen.label: project-empty
projectOpen.title: N5 Kanji & and Kanji Story quiz:
projectOpen.projectDescription: This is my most advanced Android Java project to date: a JPLT N5 Kanji & Kanji Story multiple-choice quiz app, available on Google Play store. This app consist of 95 Java classes spread across 7 packages, with a total of 54,039 lines of code (excluding the XML resources).
